intro: Gymnosciadium pusillum, commonly known as the dwarf gymnosciadium, is a small, herbaceous plant belonging to the Apiaceae family. It is characterized by its slender, branched stems and small, greenish-yellow flowers that appear in umbels. The plant is native to certain regions of Europe and is often found in moist, shaded habitats. Its leaves are finely divided and have a delicate, fern-like appearance. Gymnosciadium pusillum is typically short-lived and has a limited geographic distribution.
